name: Ma-Po Tofu (Simmered Tofu With Ground Pork)
description: I have long enjoyed stir-fried tofu creations like ma-po tofu, a classic dish from Sichuan. But I found making them difficult. This version is easy and quick.
keywords: garlic, ginger, ground pork, pork, scallion, tofu, main course
recipeIngredient: 1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, plus more to taste
1/2 cup chopped scallions, green part only
1 pound soft or silken tofu, cut in 1/2-inch cubes

recipeInstructions.text: Put oil in a deep 10-inch skillet or wok, preferably nonstick, and turn heat to medium-high. A minute later, add garlic, ginger and red pepper flakes, and cook just until they begin to sizzle, less than a minute. Add pork, and stir to break it up; cook, stirring occasionally, until it loses most of its pink color.

Add scallions and stir; add stock. Cook for a minute or so, scraping bottom of pan with a wooden spoon if necessary to loosen any stuck bits of meat, then add tofu. Cook, stirring once or twice, until tofu is heated through, about 2 minutes.
Stir in the soy sauce; taste, and add salt and red pepper flakes as necessary. Garnish with cilantro if you like, and serve.
